channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Pressure on ICU staff concerning, Hywel Dda consultant says
item.description: An ICU consultant says staff shortages are making him "dread" the winter months.

item.title: Nicola Faith fishing boat: Families to set up charity to improve sea safety
item.description: Three fishermen died off the Conwy coast after the Nicola Faith sank in January.

item.title: Betsi Cadwaladr senior staff move after mental health patient's death
item.description: The north Wales health board says an investigation is continuing after a female patient dies.

item.title: Ceredigion: Seal pup dies after selfie snappers scare mother
item.description: Tourists have been urged to stay away from their pups which are sometimes seen off Wales' coast.

item.title: Covid: Welsh ambulance service asks for military help again
item.description: The request comes due to increasing pressure from Covid cases and a predicted "tough winter".

item.title: Welsh Cambrian Mountains lamb granted protected status
item.description: The name has been given protection in the UK under the replacement for the EU's scheme.

item.title: Electricity energy costs damaging sector, says UK Steel
item.description: Some firms are being forced to temporarily pause production when the price goes "through the roof".

item.title: CO2: Food and drink fears for Wales over carbon dioxide cuts
item.description: One of Britain's biggest poultry processors says there needs to be urgent action within days.

item.title: Covid: Welsh Labour conference cancelled ahead of expected autumn peak
item.description: A thousand people were expected to attend but there are fears of a peak in cases in November.

item.title: Aberystwyth University: Wales' first vet school opens
item.description: The first 25 students are starting their five-year degree course in Aberystwyth.

item.title: Climate change: Demolition to start on Wales' most polluted street
item.description: Preparatory work on the 23 homes due for demolition is to start following months of delays.

item.title: Covid: ICU consultant at Glangwili hospital describes pressure
item.description: An intensive care consultant says pressure is as intense as at any point during the past 18 months.

item.title: Nicola Faith fishing boat sinking: 'Grieving has only just started' for families
item.description: The families of three drowned fishermen are setting up a charity to improve sea safety.

item.title: Drink-drivers are selfish, says Ammanford woman hit by car
item.description: Finley Taylor was hit by a drink-driver as she walked her dog with her husband.

item.title: Planes turned into graffiti canvasses by street artist
item.description: Street artist Jim Vision had an idea for what to do with planes that have ended their flying days.

item.title: Covid Passes to be compulsory at 'high risk' venues in Wales
item.description: The pass confirms your vaccination status or negative lateral flow test within the previous 48 hours.

item.title: Covid: Care homes were on their own, says widow
item.description: Running a care home during the pandemic contributed to Vernon Hough's suicide, his widow says.

item.title: Steve Cooper: Nottingham Forest appoint ex-Swansea City boss after agreeing compensation
item.description: Nottingham Forest appoint Steve Cooper as head coach after they agree compensation with former club Swansea City.

item.title: Sophie Ingle: Big scores show ‘massive gap’ still exists, says Wales captain
item.description: Sophie Ingle says Wales' 6-0 win over Kazakhstan and England's 8-0 victory over North Macedonia show a "massive gap" still exists within the women's game.

item.title: World Cup qualifiers: It's now or never for some of the older Wales players - Helen Ward
item.description: Veteran Wales striker Helen Ward says it feels like "now or never" for her and other senior players in their 2023 Women's World Cup qualifying campaign.

item.title: Gareth Bale: Wales and Real Madrid forward has 'important' injury, says Carlo Ancelotti
item.description: Carlo Ancelotti is unsure when Gareth Bale will return to action after suffering what the Real Madrid boss describes as an "important" injury.

item.title: Zoe Backstedt: Welsh rider wins junior World time trial silver
item.description: Great Britain's Zoe Backstedt wins silver in the women's junior time trial at the Road Cycling World Championships in Belgium.

item.title: 'Pwysau cynddrwg os nad gwaeth nag ers dechrau Covid'
item.description: Staff gofal critigol yn ofni pa mor wael fydd y sefyllfa erbyn y gaeaf gan eu bod eisoes dan straen.

item.title: Arweinwyr uned Hergest 'wedi'u symud' yn dilyn marwolaeth
item.description: Mae rhai o arweinwyr uned iechyd meddwl Hergest wedi eu symud o'u swyddi ar ôl i glaf farw yno.

item.title: Sefydlu elusen er cof am griw cwch y Nicola Faith
item.description: Bwriad yr elusen fydd gwella diogelwch ar y môr er cof am dri physgotwr fu farw wedi i'w cwch suddo.

item.title: A-Z Geiriadur Prifysgol Cymru: 100 mlynedd mewn 30 gair
item.description: Yr Athro Ann Parry Owen sy'n rhoi tarddiad ambell i air Cymraeg diddorol

item.title: Y Bencampwriaeth: Caerdydd 0-1 Bournemouth
item.description: Gôl Philip Billing yn yr ail hanner yn ddigon i sicrhau buddugoliaeth i'r Cherries yn erbyn Caerdydd.
